intro: Psychotria polyphlebia, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Psychotria polyphlebia is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally by indigenous communities for various therapeutic purposes.
